t: Prayer for Deliverance from Secret Enemies.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
Hear*pn my voice, O God, in my complaint; Preserve*ln my life from dread of the enemy.
Hide*ln me from the secret counsel of evildoers, From*ln the tumult of those who do iniquity,
Who*ln have sharpened their tongue like a sword. They*ln aimed bitter speech as*i their arrow,
To*ln shoot from concealment at the blameless; Suddenly*ln they shoot at him, and do not fear.
They*ln hold fast to themselves an evil purpose; They*ln talk of laying snares secretly; They*ln say, “Who can see them?”
They*ln devise injustices, saying,*i “We*ln are ready with a well-conceived plot”; For*ln the inward thought and the heart of a man are deep.
But*ln God will shoot at them with an arrow; Suddenly*ln they will be wounded.
So*ln they will make him stumble; Their*ln own tongue is against them; All*ln who see them will shake the head.
Then*ln all men will fear, And*ln they will declare the work of God, And*ln will consider what He has done.
The*ln righteous man will be glad in the Lord*s and will take refuge in Him; And*ln all the upright in heart will glory.
